channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Diddy-Ellen DeGeneres old video viral after Elon Musk fuels this conspiracy theory
item.description: As Ellen DeGeneres leaves the US following Donald Trump's win, her old photos, videos, birthday wishes for P Diddy resurfaced on social media with Elon Musk fuelling one conspiracy theory that Ellen had to leave US because of her past links with Diddy. Another viral video showed when Ellen offered her mother to a young Donald Trump on a show, though jokingly.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bondi, Rubio, Wiles, Waltz: How Trump's Florida lobby is set to conquer DC
item.description: With Trump’s Mar-a-Lago estate in Palm Beach serving as a political nerve center, the state has cemented itself as a critical hub for national influence. Key Floridians are taking top spots in Trump’s administration, wielding immense sway over the direction of U.S. policies. Here’s a closer look at the power players and how they’re shaping Washington under Team Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Can Matt Gaetz return to his seat after he resigned from Congress? 5 possibilities
item.description: Matt Gaetz, it seems, does not want to return to Congress now that he opted out of the Attorney General nomination. Returning to Congress would require a special election that he has to win, but returning to Congress would also mean the report probing the sexual misconduct allegations against him would be published without any hitch. Gaetz is probably eying a different role in Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Dana White's shocking U-turn on politics after supporting Trump: 'Gross, never f**king doing this'
item.description: UFC CEO Dana White said politics is gross and disgusting and he wants nothing to do with it after he made several appearances with Donald Trump before and after the election. He clarified that his appearances and support for Donald Trump are only for Trump who is a long-time friend, it has nothing to do with the Republican party or politics.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did you know? Pam Bondi and Tim Walz are almost the same age
item.description: Pamela Jo Bondi, born November 17, 1965, in Tampa, Florida, is a seasoned attorney, former Florida Attorney General, and prominent figure in conservative circles. Known for her sharp legal mind and media-savvy approach, Bondi made waves during her two terms as Florida’s Attorney General from 2011 to 2019.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Controlled explosion' outside US embassy in London, confirms UK Police
item.description: A controlled explosion was carried out near the US Embassy in London after a suspicious package was found. Authorities are investigating the incident and have cordoned off the area. In a separate incident, a suspected prohibited item was found in luggage at Gatwick Airport, leading to the evacuation of the South Terminal and the deployment of a bomb squad.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How did Matt Gaetz go from Donald Trump’s top pick to withdrawing in eight days?
item.description: Congressman Matt Gaetz withdrew his nomination for attorney general just eight days after it was announced by President-elect Donald Trump. The nomination sparked controversy and faced opposition from within the justice department. Gaetz cited the confirmation process as a distraction and withdrew his name. Trump has since nominated former Florida attorney general Pam Bondi for the position.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Dragon believer' Joe Rogan turns The View's Joy Behar’s critique into laugh fest
item.description: Joe Rogan playfully responded to criticism from "The View" co-host Joy Behar, who accused him of spreading misinformation by believing in dragons. Behar cited Rogan's speculation about dinosaur-like creatures resembling dragons found in ancient cultures. Rogan humorously embraced the "Dragon Believer" label on social media and shared content exploring the possibility of dragons.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Once Robert F Kennedy Jr blasted Donald Trump as 'threat to democracy' and compared him to Hitler
item.description: Robert F Kennedy Jr, recently tapped as Donald Trump's secretary of health and human services, was once a vocal critic of the former president. Recordings reveal Kennedy compared Trump's rhetoric and leadership style to Hitler and Mussolini, accusing him of exploiting fear and prejudice. Despite his past criticisms, Kennedy now expresses support for Trump's vision.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Backdoor way to control access': Musk slams Australia's proposed ban on social media for children
item.description: Elon Musk criticized a proposed Australian law that would ban social media access for children under 16. The law, announced by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, would require age verification and impose hefty fines on non-compliant companies. Musk called it an attempt to control internet access for all Australians, escalating his ongoing disputes with the Australian government over social media regulations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump’s education pick Linda McMahon was sued over alleged role in enabling child abuse: Report
item.description: A lawsuit alleges that Linda McMahon, US President-elect Donald Trump's nominee for education secretary, and her husband Vince McMahon, enabled the sexual exploitation of children by a WWE employee in the 1980s. The McMahons, who deny the allegations, are accused of ignoring reports of abuse and rehiring the employee after initially firing him.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Attempt to poison me did not work': Brazil's Lula reveals assassination plot against him as Bolsonaro faces coup allegations
item.description: Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva revealed an alleged plot to poison him and Vice President Geraldo Alckmin before they took office in 2022. The revelation comes amid accusations that former President Jair Bolsonaro was involved in a coup attempt following his election loss. Bolsonaro denies the allegations on X.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.4 hits Afghanistan
item.description: A 4.4 magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan's Badakhshan region at 6:35 am IST, according to the National Centre of Seismology (NCS). The earthquake's epicenter was at a depth of 82 kilometers. This seismic event follows two earlier earthquakes in the region this week, highlighting the region's vulnerability to such natural occurrences.

item.title: 'There is no equivalence': Joe Biden calls ICC warrant for Israeli PM Netanyahu 'outrageous'
item.description: US President Joe Biden has condemned the International Criminal Court's issuance of arrest warrants for Israeli leaders, including Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, deeming them "outrageous." The White House firmly rejected the warrants, questioning the ICC's jurisdiction and expressing unwavering support for Israel's security. Republican lawmakers echoed these sentiments, with some proposing sanctions against the ICC.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trudeau to cut sales tax and send checks to millions of Canadians as election looms
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced a plan to combat rising living costs. The plan includes sending checks of 250 Canadian dollars to millions of Canadians and temporarily lifting the federal sales tax on various items. This measure comes as Trudeau faces declining popularity ahead of a potential election.

item.title: Meet Pam Bondi, Trump’s pick for US attorney general
item.description: Former Florida attorney general Pam Bondi, a staunch Trump ally, has been named the US attorney general nominee. Known for her tough stance on crime and conservative views, Bondi's nomination signals a potential shift in the Department of Justice's priorities, with an expected focus on issues like immigration and religious freedoms.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia plots to target US-linked defence projects: US intelligence
item.description: US intelligence officials are warning American defense companies, especially those supporting Ukraine, to bolster their security against potential Russian sabotage. Concerns stem from a pattern of Russia-linked sabotage in Europe, including arson attacks, raising fears of similar incidents impacting US companies domestically and abroad. Officials urge heightened security protocols and caution regarding online information sharing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un accuses US of 'aggressive and hostile' policies, warns of nuclear war risk
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Freak off': Sean Diddy Comb’s lawyers claim video of alleged assault on girlfriend was 'manipulated'
item.description: Sean Diddy Combs's lawyers are challenging a video presented by prosecutors that allegedly shows him attacking his ex-girlfriend Cassie Ventura. The defence claims the video is edited and misrepresents the 2016 incident, arguing it depicts a domestic dispute over belongings, not sex trafficking as prosecutors allege. They plan to present a forensic video analyst at Combs's bail hearing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Joe Biden forgets Celtics' name, reveals secret service code during team's White House visit
item.description: President Biden welcomed the 2024 NBA champion Boston Celtics to the White House, playfully questioning their identity before highlighting the team's values and the unifying power of sports. Biden, who revealed his Secret Service code name is "Celtic," drew a parallel to John F. Kennedy hosting the Celtics in 1963, emphasizing the tradition of celebrating champions at the White House.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
